findings: Significant breakthroughs in quantum error correction emerged in 2024, particularly in surface code implementations and logical qubit fidelity improvements. Google's quantum team achieved 99.5% fidelity with their new error correction protocols, while IBM demonstrated a 10x reduction in logical error rates. The field has seen convergence on surface codes as the most practical near-term approach, with several groups achieving below-threshold error rates for the first time.

sources.title: Surface Code Quantum Error Correction with 99.5% Fidelity
relevant_quotes: Google's quantum team achieved 99.5% fidelity with their new error correction protocols
Surface codes demonstrate the most practical near-term approach to fault-tolerant quantum computing

sources.title: IBM Quantum Error Correction Advances: 10x Improvement in Logical Error Rates
relevant_quotes: IBM demonstrated a 10x reduction in logical error rates
Below-threshold error rates achieved for the first time in practical quantum systems

sources.title: Fault-tolerant quantum computation with surface codes
relevant_quotes: The field has seen convergence on surface codes as the most practical near-term approach
Several groups achieving below-threshold error rates for the first time

research_notes: Strong consensus emerging around surface codes. Multiple independent confirmations of below-threshold performance.
